sourceMeaningMnemonic: It's <radical>rain</radical>ing on your <radical>spear</radical> that has <radical>winter</radical> <radical>power</radical>. When the warm rain hits your cold, winter spear, it creates <kanji>fog</kanji>.
meaningInfo: When warm water touches a cold spear, fog billows out and covers everything.
readingMnemonic: Through the <kanji>fog</kanji> you see the shape of a mythical <reading>kiri</reading>n (<ja>きり</ja>). You can only see the outline through the fog, but you know it's there.
readingInfo:
You walk toward the kirin through the fog. When you get close, the image before you becomes clear: it's two cans of Kirin beer on a slide.

Next time you see fog, keep your eyes peeled for the real kirin in the kiri.
